de.mrapp.android.preference

Class AbstractListPreference

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.preference.Preference
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractDialogPreference
        • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractListPreference
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, java.lang.Comparable<android.preference.Preference>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListPreference, MultiChoiceListPreference

    public abstract class AbstractListPreference
extends AbstractDialogPreference
    An abstract base class for all preferences, which provide a list of selectable items.
    Since:
    1.7.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractListPreference

        public AbstractListPreference(android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new preference, which provides a list of selectable items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context

      • AbstractListPreference

        public AbstractListPreference(android.content.Context context,
                              android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new preference, which provides a list of selectable items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet

      • AbstractListPreference

        public AbstractListPreference(android.content.Context context,
                              android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                              int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new preference, which provides a list of selectable items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • AbstractListPreference

        public AbstractListPreference(android.content.Context context,
                              android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                              int defaultStyle,
                              int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new preference, which provides a list of selectable items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

    • Method Detail

      • indexOf

        protected final int indexOf(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Return the index of the entry, a specific value corresponds to.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the entry, whose index should be returned, as an instance of the type CharSequence
        Returns:
        The index of the entry, the given value corresponds to, as an Integer value or -1 if there is no such entry

      • getDialogItemColor

        public final int getDialogItemColor()
        Returns the color of the items of the preference's dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the items as an Integer value or -1, if no custom item color is set

      • setDialogItemColor

        public final void setDialogItemColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the items of the preference's dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value or -1, if no custom item color should be set

      • getDialogItemControlColor

        public final int getDialogItemControlColor()
        Returns the color of the item controls of the preference's dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the item controls as an Integer value or -1, if no custom item color is set

      • setDialogItemControlColor

        public final void setDialogItemControlColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the item controls of the preference's dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value or -1, if no custom item control color should be set

      • getEntries

        public final java.lang.CharSequence[] getEntries()
        Returns the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Returns:
        The entries of the list, which is shown by the preference, as a CharSequence array or null, if no entries have been set

      • setEntries

        public final void setEntries(java.lang.CharSequence[] entries)
        Sets the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Parameters:
        entries - The entries, which should be set, as an CharSequence array. The entries may not be null

      • setEntries

        public final void setEntries(int resourceId)
        Sets the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the entries, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource

      • getEntryValues

        public final java.lang.CharSequence[] getEntryValues()
        Returns the values, which correspond to the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Returns:
        The values, which correspond to the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference, as a CharSequence array

      • setEntryValues

        public final void setEntryValues(java.lang.CharSequence[] entryValues)
        Sets the values, which correspond to the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Parameters:
        entryValues - The values, which should be set, as a CharSequence array. The values may not be null and the array's length must be equal to the number of list items

      • setEntryValues

        public final void setEntryValues(int resourceId)
        Sets the values, which correspond to the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the values, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource. The array's length must be equal to the number of list items

      • needInputMethod

        protected final boolean needInputMethod()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDialogPreference
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses to determine, whether the soft input mode should be requested when the preference's dialog becomes shown, or not.
        Specified by:
        needInputMethod in class AbstractDialogPreference
        Returns:
        True, if the soft input mode should be requested when the preference's dialog becomes shown, false otherwise
